job_title: Embedded System Software, Integration & Hardware Validation Intern
job_description: Embedded System Software, Integration & Hardware Validation Intern at Xilinx California HeadquartersThe System Software, Integration & Validation group plays a key role in the development of test systems and hardware for test & characterization of Xilinx’s advanced device families.Our most recent project has been for the ground-breaking Zynq-7000 All Programmable SoC, with dual core ARM processing.To support our group, we are looking for a 6-12 month intern.Depending on the intern’s skill set & internship duration, the intern will focus on 1 or more of the following areas:•         Embedded system software•         System-level stress testing•         Hardware validationTypical duties:•         Design, research and bring-up of embedded systems utilizing Xilinx FPGAs with ARM, PowerPC, or MicroBlaze CPUs•         Understand and use microprocessors in FPGAs, using microprocessor documentation as references•         Support the group in building software designs around advanced features of current and future FPGA families•         Assist in running benchmarks on standalone and on embedded operating system(e.g. Linux) environments•         Assemble test hardware from standard components. Knowledge of PC assembly, soldering, network installation is desirable.•         Develop Standalone applications for tests•         Compile Linux kernels for embedded systems•         Help automate design, test and build processes•         Develop scripts for regression tests•         Debug test failures
job_requirements: Requirements:•         Sophomore (2nd year) or Junior (3rd year) student enrolled in a Bachelors or student in a Masters Degree program in Electrical / Computer Engineering with an emphasis on embedded system development.•         Programming languages: C, PERL, Verilog (preferred)/VHDL•         Student must be available for 6-12months, starting in Jan 2015, and able to re-locate to San Jose. Shorter internships will not be considered.Open To All Majors:No
